revised_title: Heats of Dilution of Concentrated Solutions: Hydrochloric Acid, Lithium Chloride, Sodium Hydroxide, and Calcium Chloride
tldr: This article presents an experimental study of the heats of dilution of concentrated solutions of hydrochloric acid, lithium chloride, sodium hydroxide, and calcium chloride. The authors describe their methods for measuring the thermal effects of dilution and discuss the results, providing insights into the relationship between heat of dilution and concentration for these solutions.
